articles.description: Scientists developed a low-cost gel film made up of abundant materials that can pull water from the air in even the driest climates. The materials facilitating this reaction cost $2 per kilogram.
articles.content: New Delhi: More than one-third of the world's population lives in drylands, which are areas experiencing significant water shortages. Scientists and engineers at University of Texas in Austin, United… [+3214 chars]

articles.author: Christopher McFadden
articles.title: Meet Mercury: Fascinating details about the smallest planet in our solar system - Interesting Engineering
articles.description: Mercury, the smallest planet in our solar system, is a land of contradictions. Simultaneously freezing cold and boiling hot, Earth's cousin is a true survivor.
articles.content:
Aptly named after the speedy messenger god of the Roman pantheon (Hermes in the ancient Greek one), the planet Mercury is the "speed freak" of our Solar System.

articles.title: Soviet probe launched to Venus in 1972 could soon crash on Earth - India Today
articles.description: A Soviet probe launched to Venus in 1972 failed to go out of Earth's orbit. In the last 50 years, its orbit has fallen by over 7000 km, putting it on a course to crash on Earth.
